New Records: Slovakia delivered the first major shock result of Euro 2024, snatching an early goal and defending furiously to hold on for a 1-0 victory over Belgium in Group E.
Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz took advantage of a horror defensive error to put Slovakia ahead in the seventh minute

Romelu Lukaku twice had the ball in the net but was denied after VAR checks, first for offside in the 56th minute and minutes from the end when Lois Openda was adjudged to have handled in the build-up before the striker swept the ball into the net.
Pre-Game Insights: On the face of it, the group should have been a straightforward Euro 2024 group for Belgium, ranked third in the world with no other side higher than 20.
